reference_no_or_id: Criminal Appeal No. 38 of 1956, Criminal Appeal No. 467 of 1955

accussed_details.name: SHAHAMAD
allegation: Participation in the murder of Muhammad Ali

complaint_summary: SHAHAMAD reported the murder of Muhammad Ali, alleging enmity and claiming Muhammad Ali killed Gomi before being attacked by a crowd.
investigation_summary: Two conflicting reports were filed regarding the murder of Muhammad Ali. P.W. 9 alleged a group attack on Muhammad Ali, while SHAHAHAD claimed Muhammad Ali killed Gomi and was later attacked by a crowd. Both reports were investigated, but P.W. 9's report led to the prosecution.
judgment_summary: The Federal Shariat Court dismissed the appeal, maintaining convictions under Sections 148, 302/149, and 449 PPC. The court found SHAHAHAD's presence at the crime scene established by his report, strengthening the prosecution's case. The sentence was reduced from death to life imprisonment.
punishment: Life imprisonment for murder (reduced from death penalty).
legal_arguments: Admissibility of SHAHAHAD's report under Section 25 of the Evidence Act.
Interpretation of 'in the course of investigation' under Section 162 of the Criminal Procedure Code.

witness_statement.P.W. 9: Reported a group attack on Muhammad Ali involving guns and spears.
witness_statement.P.W. 18: Investigated both reports and registered SHAHAHAD's report separately.
witness_statement.P.W. 2: Recorded P.W. 9's statement at the police station.

key_issues: Admissibility of evidence under Section 25 of the Evidence Act.
Interpretation of Section 162 Criminal Procedure Code.

maxims.Confession: An admission of a gravely incriminating fact is not necessarily a confession.

legal_terms.Confession: A statement admitting all facts constituting the offense.
legal_terms.Investigation: Steps taken in furtherance of a pending investigation.

words_and_phrases.In the course of investigation: Refers to steps taken specifically in furtherance of a pending investigation.

summary_vector_notes: SHAHAHAD's appeal was dismissed by the Federal Shariat Court, affirming convictions under Sections 148, 302/149, and 449 PPC. The court relied on SHAHAHAD's report to establish his presence at the crime scene, strengthening the prosecution's case. The judgment clarified the admissibility of evidence under Section 25 of the Evidence Act and the interpretation of 'in the course of investigation' under Section 162 Criminal Procedure Code.

key_points.high_court_decision: Relied on eye-witnesses and appellant's report

defense_position.appellant: Denied presence at the village during the occurrence
